intro: Manglietia hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan manglietia, is a rare evergreen shrub native to the tropical forests of Hainan Island in China. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae, which includes some of the most ancient flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. It is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
